techmeme.title: Grok replied with information about South Africa's "white genocide" when X users asked it to fact-check unrelated topics; the issue appears to have been fixed (Jay Peters/The Verge)
Waymo recalls 1,212 vehicles to update software and address collision risks, after the NHTSA opened an investigation in May 2024 following reports of incidents (Reuters)
OpenAI releases GPT-4.1 for Plus, Pro, and Team users in ChatGPT, and replaces GPT-4o mini with GPT-4.1 mini for all ChatGPT users (Maxwell Zeff/TechCrunch)
Netflix says its ad-supported tier now has 94M MAUs, up from 70M in November 2024, and reaches more 18- to 34-year-olds than any US broadcast or cable network (Sara Salinas/CNBC)
The CFPB withdraws its proposal for new rules to more tightly regulate US data brokers and their ability to sell sensitive information about Americans (Wired)

source_2.title: Co-op says shelves to be more fully stocked this weekend
Airbnb offers private chefs and massages as it revamps app
AI tool put to test sifting public views on botox and fillers
M&S says customer data stolen in cyber attack
US cuts tariffs on small parcels from Chinese firms like Shein and Temu
